articles.author: CNN
articles.title: Girl’s tooth found in Laos cave could be first ancient fossil of its kind in Southeast Asia - 7NEWS
articles.description: The girl was likely a Denisovan, a group from over 130,000 years ago which once mated with Homo sapiens - their DNA still lives on in some humans today.
articles.content:
A tooth unearthed from a remote cave in Laos is helping to sketch an unknown chapter in the human story.
Researchers believe the tooth belonged to a young female who lived at least 130,000 years ago… [+5709 chars]

articles.title: Child’s 130,000-year-old tooth could offer clues to extinct human relative - The Guardian
articles.description: Researchers believe the discovery in a Laos cave proves that Denisovans lived in the warm tropics of southeast Asia
articles.content:

articles.title: Singapore records highest ever temperature for May - The Star Online
articles.description: SINGAPORE (The Straits Times/Asia News Network): The rest of May is expected to be warmer and drier than the first half of the month, with the mercury forecast to hit a high of 36 deg C on a few days, said the weatherman on Tuesday (May 17).
